pull_request.title: Restructure distance data collection
pull_request.body:
## Description
Restructures the way distance data is collected and interpreted back to the same way it was before #14668, but keeping the technical refactoring etc.

Attempts to fix issue #14763 and maybe #14765.

I was not able to reproduce any of those two issues, so I cannot check the effectiveness of this PR.
Thus: Can anyone out there having one or both of those issues check the build from this PR?
(Otherwise we might put it into the nightlies, update related issues, and wait a bit for feedback.)

repo.name: cgeo
repo.description: c:geo - The powerful Android geocaching app.

issue.title: (only pedestrian) routing lost - how to recover or is it a bug?

labels.name: Unverified
labels.description: Issue not yet confirmed/reproduced or feature requests not yet checked for plausibility

issue.body:
### Describe your problem!

I'm often walking for caches, that means I use the pedestrian routing profile and this worked very well.
As preparation for a "far from home trip" I downloaded map and routing information to do the same abroad (cache walks in the city). But when I tried to route "pedestrian" in the city this did not work. Also updating the routing information did not help. I thought that all routing capability has lost, although all settings seem ok - it also does not differ between cgeo internal and brouter routing.

When now back in my home location I accidently switched to "bike routing" and surprisingly that works - the same as car routing. Only "pedestrian routing" is still lost and I don't know, how to recover or reset it.

### How to reproduce?

select a cache and switch in fast settings between the different routing capabilities.

none, bike, car are working
pedestrian does same as none.

### Actual result after these steps?

pedistrian  shows a straight line between my position and the selected cache. Bike, Car a routed line to the cache

### Expected result after these steps?

also ped. routing should show a "route".

### Reproducible

Yes

### c:geo Version

2023.09.26

### System information


comment.body:
Hi.

I had this issue with the latest version of C:Geo on OpenAndroMaps with Elevation Theme (Android 13 - Poco F4 GT)
With Hiking routing worked, but Car didn't -> Geocache https://coord.info/GCAFDHV .
This geocache is 1 or 2 meters off the road.

What I did that solved the Issue.
I opened geocache https://coord.info/GC6W2DV with routing for Car selected, and the route was generated.

Since then the issue is gone.

issue.title: Next feature release 2023.10.xx
issue.body:
I'll start preparing a new beta version tonight. Let's use this thread to collect any issues that arrive during beta phase that need to be fixed before final release. Feel free to edit this initial post for adding such issues:

- [ ] ?? #14736
- [x] #14681
- [x] #14729 (cherry-pick from `master`)
- [x] #14744
- [ ] ?? #14745
- [x] #14760

comment.body:
We have several issues with regard to distance info (thanks @Lineflyer for creating the issues) - for some users info is missing completely, for others it's flickering, and some can't change from regular to super-size view. No clear reproducibility in general and no clear pattern yet, but constantly happening for the users affected.

This is very likely related to the refactoring of the distance info view. Where we had an ugly mess of quite a few dedicated views for regular and supersized views in the past, it's been consolidated to just a few remaining views / containers, which get filled dynamically. Sadly, it seems to be non-working under certain, yet unknown, conditions.

The refactoring is also the base for the new elevation info for current position, where we have a separate active discussion about.

Therefore my proposal:
- Remove the elevation info for now and revert the PR related to both refactoring the distance views (#14668, #14690) and elevation info (#14671).
- This will also require to revert the new distance info icons (#14752) sadly, but those may be implemented separately from both refacoring and elevation info.
- Postpone the refactoring of distance info for now and let's restart on `master` later, when we have a better understanding on the patterns causing problems for some users.
- Discuss the whole topic of "elevation-related info" and restart implementation of it when we have a clearer image of what we want to achieve.

comment.body:
> @moving-bits You might want to have a look into support ticket 118609 On Facebook there are several users with this issue (not showing any distance to a cache after upgrade). I did not manage to reproduce it. Not sure what setting might got lost...

I took this and some other issues reported by users to dedicated issues, which is probably better to track those down.
All issues deal with the map distance infos btw.

issue.title: Make "toggle talking" to a real toggle-button

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: A request for a new feature/function

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem?**
Not really. Just consistency in UI.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
The menu-entry "toggle talking" should be a real toggle button like "Prevent waypoint from note". There the text is changing due to the current setting.
So the two states could be
- Start talking / Start speech
- Stop talking / Stop speech

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
Implementation like the other toggle-button. New icon is necessary (could be easily created from original icon and "main_nearby_disabled.png"

**Additional context**
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70113341/94975124-ef757500-0510-11eb-8c2b-d936145e1f41.png)

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70113341/94996544-9c99cd00-05a5-11eb-87cf-e0a28fdc9e8a.png)

issue.title: Elevation info needs a better icon

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: A request for a new feature/function

labels.name: Unverified
labels.description: Issue not yet confirmed/reproduced or feature requests not yet checked for plausibility

issue.body:
### Describe your problem!

I talked to some beta users and even myself was fooled by the elevation info on the map.
As it shows "a ramp" users might first thing, that it shows an elevation difference (e.g. if a route is active in parallel).
This is emphasized by the fact, that its shown in the same screen area, which normally only shows distances to target, routing length, etc.

At least we should IMHO try to find a better icon, ideally we could also find a better place to show that info on the map screen (e.g. upper left instead upper right) to visualize its not related to routing and distance information.

Ideas for icons....did not check usage conditions:
![image](https://github.com/cgeo/cgeo/assets/949669/f8c68fcc-1518-4487-b746-67956d2ed281)
Source: https://www.flaticon.com/de/kostenloses-icon/elevation_9620066

### How to reproduce?

see above

### Actual result after these steps?

_No response_

### Expected result after these steps?

_No response_

### Reproducible

Yes

### c:geo Version

Nightly/Beta

### System information

_No response_

### Additional Information

_No response_

comment.body:
As long as it's placed right below route info items it'll alway be associated with routing imho.
How about showing it in another place - and maybe together with the users current coordinates? Altitude is really just 1 of the 3 dimensionsy if they are shown together itll be clear.
